page.title: 11Bernwode Forest-Oakley
page.content: Edward the confessor, son of Ethelred 11, was the last saxon king to die.He died in bed in 1066. He was born at Islip in Oxfordshire, between 1002-1005 and lived 30 years in Normandy.He was crowned when the Canute family died in 1042.He had no children and recognised Harold,son of Godwine, as his heir.He is believed to have had a palace in Brill. Bernwode Forest was part of the Royal Hunting ground.It is made up Shabbington and Oakley woods (formely Griffin wood).The forest has been documented since Edward the Confessor,it has mainly conifers.With a variety of young deciduous trees such as oak.It is part of a nature reserve with a variety of wild flowers,insects, and especially butterflies.Deer and rabbits form part of the wild life living in the forest.
